tasks.description: "Semantic Bug Detection Process para sa MainPC Agents

todos.text: "Semantic Bug Detection Process para sa MainPC Agents

tasks.description: Semantic Bug Detection Process ‚Äì MainPC AgentsPhase 1: Systematic Agent AnalysisExtract agent pathsSource: startup_config.yamlCategorize agents by functionGroup: foundation, memory, utility, etc.Prioritize critical agentsFocus: ServiceRegistry, SystemDigitalTwin, RequestCoordinatorPhase 2: Multi-Level Code AnalysisFor each agent:A. Import & Dependency AnalysisCheck all imports are validVerify dependencies match startup_config.yamlIdentify circular importsB. Class & Method Structure AnalysisValidate class inheritance treeCheck method signatures (params, return types)Verify async/sync consistencyC. Logic Flow AnalysisTrace request/response logicReview error handling codeValidate state management patternsD. Integration Point AnalysisReview ZMQ comms (send/receive patterns)Check port config matches specVerify health check logicPhase 3: Semantic Bug DetectionSpot-check common semantic bugs:Resource ManagementMemory leaks (long-running agents)Unclosed file handlesImproper cleanup in async codeState SynchronizationRace conditions in shared stateInconsistent state updatesDeadlock risksError PropagationSilent failures (no log, no raise)Bad exception handlingMissing error loggingCommunication ProtocolZMQ message format mismatchesPort conflictsPoor timeout handlingConfiguration DependenciesMissing/invalid config valuesBad defaultsBroken env variable usePhase 4: Automated Analysis ToolsRun static analysis (Python)Generate dependency graphCompute code complexity metricsDetect import cyclesPhase 5: Report GenerationFor each agent:‚úÖ Passed checks‚ö†Ô∏è Warnings (potential issues)‚ùå Critical issues (must fix)üìã Recommendations

tasks.description: Perform a comprehensive audit of the agent codebase located in 'main_pc_code/', using 'main_pc_code/config/startup_config.yaml' as the manifest of agents to analyze. For each agent, identify and list the following: all coding patterns (naming, structure), all imports (with frequency counts), error handling approaches, and any notable code smells or anti-patterns. Finally, generate a summary table of all observed patterns, highlighting any inconsistencies.

todos.text: Finally, generate a summary table of all observed patterns, highlighting any inconsistencies.
-patterns
For each agent, identify and list the following: all coding patterns (naming, structure), all imports (with frequency counts), error handling approaches, and any notable code smells or anti-patterns.
yaml' as the manifest of agents to analyze
yaml' as the manifest of agents to analyze.
analyze

tasks.description: "Initiate a non-destructive audit of the 'mainpc_code' codebase. Your goal is to identify all potential candidates for cleanup, including orphan files, unused code, and redundant assets. Consolidate all your findings into a single, detailed markdown report named 'cleanup_plan.md'. This report must categorize each item with a proposed action ([DELETE], [REFACTOR], [ARCHIVE]) and provide a clear, evidence-based justification for each proposal. Do not modify or delete any files in this phase."

todos.text: Review the 'mainpc_code' codebase to identify orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Create a list categorizing each identified item as orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Develop a markdown template 'cleanup_plan.md' with sections for orphan files, unused code segments, and redundant assets
Populate the markdown template with findings from step one using IF condition: then action logic
For each identified item in the codebase: IF it is an orphan file THEN propose [ARCHIVE], ELSEIF unused, THEN suggest [REFACTOR] (if applicable), OTHERWISE recommend [DELETE]
Write evidence-based justifications for each proposed action within the markdown report
Review and finalize 'cleanup_plan.md' for accuracy and completeness
